DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare effectiveness cognitive behavioural therapy ( CBT ) physical therapy ( PT ) pain psychosexual outcome woman provoke vestibulodynia ( PVD ) .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Cognitive Behavioural Therapy Physical Therapy Provoked Vestibulodynia
DOC.detailed_description: Provoked vestibulodynia ( PVD ) common condition lead painful intercourse currently best understood within biopsychosocial framework . Although usefulness non-medical treatment option vulvar pain recognize many , limited research investigate effectiveness treatment use biopsychosocial approach outcome measurement . Furthermore , little evidence support mechanism treatment lead pain reduction . This study aim address gap investigate two non-medical treatment option : individual cognitive-behavioural therapy ( CBT ) physical therapy ( PT ) .
DOC.criteria: fluent English vulvar pain attempt vaginal penetration least 6 month pain limited vulvar vestibule cotton swab test serious medical , psychiatric , pain condition generalize vulvodynia and/or significant vaginismus ( i.e. , able least one finger insert vaginally ) current pregnancy , breastfeed , less 6 month postpartum unwillingness abstain treatment PVD pain course study
